reporting-org.narrative: Ministry for Foreign Affairs of Finland

title.narrative: Frame agreement with NGO (Suomen Lahetysseura ry)

description.narrative: Project aims to improve the status and realization of rights of persons with disabilities living around Usambara Mountains. Special emphasis will be in deaf people and sign language. 2014 will be mainly planning stage and implementation will take place in 2015-2017. The main problem of deaf people in Tanzania is communication. Sign language is not known, special schools are few, inclusive education not sufficiently adopted and teachers lack knowledge and skills of special needs education. Therefore, only a very small percentage of deaf children go to school. This project, implemented by SEKOMU University, will improve the living standard of deaf people around Usambara Mountains. Additionally, Tanzanian sign language and the university program of special need s education will be developed further so that the students of the special needs education program will be equipped with good sign language and pedagogic skills. Beneficiaries of the project are SEKOMU University special needs education program and student s, and deaf people of the project area, specifically children and young people. Project is implemented by Sebastian Kolowa Memorial University (SEKOMU) which is the only university in Tanzania with special needs education program. SEKOMU is owned by FELM l ongtime partner, North Eastern Diocese of the Evangelical Lutheran Church in Tanzania (ELCT-NED).
